title: Fuet magazine masthead (serif)
content:
Can anyone shed any light on this masthead? It may well be custom, but would be interested to know if anything like it exists...

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [FUET-00.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824094848/http:/typophile.com/files/FUET-00.jpg) | 178.4 KB |
author: Arran

comments.content:
Should be 'Titania', slightly modified. One of its digitization is [Titania](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824094848/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/steffmann/samples/t/titania.htm) by Dieter Steffmann.  
Thanks to Don, here you could read more about 'Titania': [http://typophile.com/node/105398#comment-562398](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824094848/http:/typophile.com/node/105398#comment-562398 "http://typophile.com/node/105398#comment-562398")

As I said in my previous post the original name is unknown but the Solo version was Titania. I discussed who might have done original digitizations and who were the copycats. The problem is that the likely original digital fonts are very difficult to obtain legitimately. For commercial use I recommend the Solofont digital version included in Dover/Solofont Art Nouveau book + CD pack. The Steffmann version is a pirated copy.  
Don
Thanks so much for the info guys. Greatly appreciated.
